briefdescription.para: Validate a date represented by a 7-byte array.

parameterdescription.para:
7-byte array representing the date:
Indexes 0 and 1 contain a 2-byte year (e.g., 0x07E7 for 2023).
Index 2 contains the month.
Index 3 contains the day.
Index 4 contains the hour.
Index 5 contains the minute.
Index 6 contains the second.

simplesect.para: true if the date is valid, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Create an Object in the Object Server and send an object changed indication if a client is connected.

parameterdescription.para: Desired Object Size.
Desired Object Type UUID, can be either 16 or 128 bits long.
Set to true if the type is 128 bits long.

simplesect.para: 1 if the request is unsuccessful, 0 if the request is successful.

briefdescription.para: Delete the selected Object in the Object Server.

simplesect.para: 1 if the request is unsuccessful, 0 if the request is successful.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t objId[6], uint32_t offset, uint32_t length, uint32_t *checksum)
memberdef.name: OtsUiCalculateChecksum

briefdescription.para: Calculate the checksum for the currently selected object.

parameterdescription.para: Offset of the data within the object.
Length of the data for which the checksum is calculated.
Calculated checksum.

simplesect.para: 1 if the request is unsuccessful, 0 if the request is successful.

briefdescription.para: Read an Object from the Object Server and print its contents.

parameterdescription.para: Object to read.
Pointer to the offset of the data within the object.
Pointer to the length of the data to be read.
Ponter to the data read from the object if succesful, NULL otherwise

simplesect.para: 1 if the request is unsuccessful, 0 if the request is successful.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t objId[6], uint32_t length, uint32_t offset, uint8_t *pBuff)
memberdef.name: OtsUiWriteObjectData

briefdescription.para: Write data to an Object in the Object Server.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data to be written.
Offset of the data within the object.
Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written.

simplesect.para: 1 if the request is unsuccessful, 0 if the request is successful.

briefdescription.para: Attempt to abort the data transfer of an OACP read operation in progress.

parameterdescription.para: Filter Characteristic to update: 1, 2, or 3.

simplesect.para: 0 if the operation is successful, 1 if the operation fails.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t filterId, enum OtsFilterCondition condition, char *name, uint8_t nameLen)
memberdef.name: OtsUiFilterName

briefdescription.para: Update one of the 3 Object Filter characteristics with an Object name condition.

parameterdescription.para: Filter Characteristic to update: 1, 2, or 3.

Object name condition to apply:
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_NAME_START_WITH: Indicates the object name should start with the specified name.
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_NAME_END_WITH: Indicates the object name should end with the specified name.
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_NAME_CONTAINS: Indicates the object name should contain the specified name.
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_NAME_IS_EXACTLY: Indicates the object name should exactly match the specified name.
Object name to use as a condition in the filter.
Length of the Object name.

simplesect.para: 0 if the operation is successful, 1 if the operation fails.

briefdescription.para: Update one of the 3 Object Filter characteristics with an Object type condition.

parameterdescription.para: Filter Characteristic to update: 1, 2, or 3.
Object type to use as a condition in the filter.
Length of the Object type. It can be either ATT_128_UUID_LEN or ATT_16_UUID_LEN.

simplesect.para: 0 if the operation is successful, 1 if the operation fails.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t filterId, enum OtsFilterCondition condition, uint8_t date1[7], uint8_t date2[7])
memberdef.name: OtsUiFilterDate

briefdescription.para: Update one of the 3 Object Filter characteristics with an Object date condition.

parameterdescription.para: Filter Characteristic to update: 1, 2, or 3.

Object date condition to apply:
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_CREATED_BETWEEN: Indicates the object should be created between the specified dates.
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_MODIFIED_BETWEEN: Indicates the object should be modified between the specified dates.
7-byte date array representing the start date.
7-byte date array representing the end date.

simplesect.para:
The date array follows the following format:
Indexes 0 and 1 contain a 2-byte year (e.g., 0x07E7 for 2023).
Index 2 contains the month.
Index 3 contains the day.
Index 4 contains the hour.
Index 5 contains the minute.
Index 6 contains the second.
0 if the operation is successful, 1 if the operation fails.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t filterId, enum OtsFilterCondition condition, uint32_t size1, uint32_t size2)
memberdef.name: OtsUiFilterSize

briefdescription.para: Update one of the 3 Object Filter characteristics with an Object size condition.

parameterdescription.para: Filter Characteristic to update: 1, 2, or 3.

Object size condition to apply:
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_ALLOC_SIZE_BETWEEN: Indicates the object should have allocated size between the specified sizes.
OTPS_FILTER_TYPE_CURRENT_SIZE_BETWEEN: Indicates the object should have current size between the specified sizes.
First size parameter for the condition.
Second size parameter for the condition.

simplesect.para: 0 if the operation is successful, 1 if the operation fails.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t objId[6], uint8_t attType, uint8_t *att, uint8_t attLen)
memberdef.name: OtsUiSetObjAttribute

briefdescription.para: Set one of the possible attributes for a desired object.

parameterdescription.para: Object ID representing the desired object.

Type of attribute to be set.
OTP_VFS_ATTRIBUTE_NAME: String of up to 64 bytes.
OTP_VFS_ATTRIBUTE_CREATE_TIME: 7-byte long date formatted.
OTP_VFS_ATTRIBUTE_MODIFY_TIME: 7-byte long date formatted.
OTP_VFS_ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY: 32-bit unsigned integer.
Pointer to the attribute value to be set.
Length of the attribute value.

simplesect.para: 1 if the request is unsuccessful, 0 if the request is successful.

briefdescription.para: Perform the OLCP GoTo Operation as if the client requested it, to select an object from the Object List by its ID.

parameterdescription.para: 48-bit Object ID to look for.

simplesect.para: 0 if the operation is successful, 1 if the operation fails.
This is a debug function! Be careful when using it. It WILL cause sync issues with the connected client, as it modifies the currently selected object for the server.
